answers.answer: HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!The symptoms of lower right abdominal pain, also felt in the back can be due to appendicitis. The pain, can at times come and go and not give the classic picture. Crohn’s disease, diverticulitis, infection in kidney, kidney stones, constipation, ovary involvement in women, ectopic pregnancy in women, and mesentry (a thin tissue that carries the blood, nerves and lymphatics for the intestine) involvement can all cause lower right abdomen pain. Constipation in itself can cause these symptoms. Chronic constipation can be due to diet poor in roughage or fiber and also due to dehydration. Diabetes and hypothyroidism, colon disorders, irritable bowel syndrome, diverticular diseases, cancers, severe acidity etc can all cause constipation. A proper investigation is required preferably by a gastroenterologist (a doctor who looks after the digestive system) and a physician to know what is the cause. The treatment will follow correct diagnosis. It is difficult to comment beyond this without examining. Take care!

question: Hi I am  20 year old Female. I been having lower right abdominal pains, lower right back pain and some times lower left back pain. I just noticed after I urinated and wiped I noticed blood on the tp. I have been tested for an UTI a week ago that came back clear. I have been having this pain for three weeks now and I just noticed the blood on the tp. I just saw my PCP earlier today no test were rechecked to see if anything has change. The pain started in my abdomin then progressed into my back. I have been sick to my stomach, constipated, with no fever. Any advise would be great.
title: How worried should I be
